## ytdl

**Parameters**

-   `link` **[string][31]** 
-   `options` **![Object][32]** 

Returns **ReadableStream** 

### InstallMiniGet

Chooses a format to download.

**Parameters**

-   `miniget`  
-   `stream` **[stream.Readable][33]** 
-   `info` **[Object][32]** 
-   `options` **[Object][32]** 

### InstallMiniGet

Can be used to download video after its `info` is gotten through
`ytdl.getInfo()`. In case the user might want to look at the
`info` object before deciding to download.

**Parameters**

-   `miniget`  
-   `info` **[Object][32]** 
-   `options` **![Object][32]** 

## getBasicInfo

Gets info from a video without getting additional formats.

**Parameters**

-   `id` **[string][31]** 
-   `options` **[Object][32]** 
-   `callback`

-   `callback`

## sortFormats

Sort formats from highest quality to lowest.
By resolution, then video bitrate, then audio bitrate.

**Parameters**

-   `a` **[Object][32]** 
-   `b` **[Object][32]** 

## chooseFormat

Choose a format depending on the given options.

**Parameters**

-   `formats` **[Array][34]&lt;[Object][32]>** 
-   `options` **[Object][32]** 

Returns **([Object][32] \| [Error][36])**

## indexOf

String#indexOf() that supports regex too.

**Parameters**

-   `haystack` **[string][31]** 
-   `needle` **([string][31] \| [RegExp][38])** 

Returns **[number][39]** 

## validQueryDomains

Get video ID.

There are a few type of video URL formats.

-   [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][40]
-   [https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][41]
-   [https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID][42]
-   [https://www.youtube.com/v/VIDEO_ID][43]
-   [https://www.youtube.com/embed/VIDEO_ID][44]
-   [https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][45]
-   [https://gaming.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][46]

**Parameters**

-   `link` **[string][31]** 

Returns **([string][31] \| [Error][36])** 

## idRegex

Returns true if given id satifies YouTube's id format.

**Parameters**

-   `id` **[string][31]** 

Returns **[boolean][35]** 

## formats

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube#Quality_and_formats][47]

## getTokens

Extract signature deciphering tokens from html5player file.

**Parameters**

-   `html5playerfile` **[string][31]** 
-   `options` **[Object][32]** 
-   `callback`  

## decipher

Decipher a signature based on action tokens.

**Parameters**

-   `tokens` **[Array][34]&lt;[string][31]>** 
-   `sig` **[string][31]** 

Returns **[string][31]** 

## extractActions

Extracts the actions that should be taken to decipher a signature.

This searches for a function that performs string manipulations on
the signature. We already know what the 3 possible changes to a signature
are in order to decipher it. There is

-   Reversing the string.
-   Removing a number of characters from the beginning.
-   Swapping the first character with another position.

Note, `Array#slice()` used to be used instead of `Array#splice()`,
it's kept in case we encounter any older html5player files.

After retrieving the function that does this, we can see what actions
it takes on a signature.

**Parameters**

-   `body` **[string][31]** 

Returns **[Array][34]&lt;[string][31]>** 

## setDownloadURL

**Parameters**

-   `format` **[Object][32]** 
-   `sig` **[string][31]** 
-   `debug` **[boolean][35]** 

## decipherFormats

Applies `sig.decipher()` to all format URL's.

**Parameters**

-   `formats` **[Array][34]&lt;[Object][32]>** 
-   `tokens` **[Array][34]&lt;[string][31]>** 
-   `debug` **[boolean][35]** 

## swapHeadAndPosition

Swaps the first element of an array with one of given position.

**Parameters**

-   `arr` **[Array][34]&lt;[Object][32]>** 
-   `position` **[number][39]** 

Returns **[Array][34]&lt;[Object][32]>**
